# sailpoint_source_provisioning_policy (Data Source)

Retrieves a single SailPoint source provisioning policy. A provisioning policy defines the fields and transformations required for a specific operation type.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "sailpoint_source_provisioning_policy" "create" {
  source_id  = "2c91808a7813090a017813467c744b01"
  usage_type = "CREATE"
}

output "policy_name" {
  value = data.sailpoint_source_provisioning_policy.create.name
}

output "policy_fields" {
  value = data.sailpoint_source_provisioning_policy.create.fields
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `source_id` (String) The ID of the source to retrieve the provisioning policy from.
- `usage_type` (String) The usage type of the provisioning policy (e.g., `CREATE`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `ENABLE`, `DISABLE`, `ASSIGN`, `UNASSIGN`, `CREATE_GROUP`, `UPDATE_GROUP`, `DELETE_GROUP`, `REGISTER`, `CREATE_IDENTITY`, `UPDATE_IDENTITY`, `EDIT_GROUP`, `UNLOCK`, `CHANGE_PASSWORD`).

### Read-Only

- `description` (String) The description of the provisioning policy.
- `fields` (Attributes List) The list of fields defined by the provisioning policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--fields))
- `name` (String) The name of the provisioning policy.

<a id="nestedatt--fields"></a>
### Nested Schema for `fields`

Read-Only:

- `attributes` (String) Additional attributes for the field as a JSON object.
- `is_multi_valued` (Boolean) Whether the field supports multiple values.
- `is_required` (Boolean) Whether the field is required.
- `name` (String) The name of the field.
- `transform` (String) The transformation applied to the field as a JSON object.
- `type` (String) The type of the field.
